page.title: 02"Metheringham Neighbours"
page.content: Blankney is one mile South of Metheringham on the B1188. Blankney has a population of 290.The houses are mostly of stone.There is an 18 hole golf course as well as a post office and a church.The church is situated outside the village. The working population of the village consists of farm workers, golf course workers and commuters to Lincoln and Sleaford.The Blankney Hunt was founded by Henry Chaplin in 1871. The Hunt starts from Blankney Hall which used to have its own railway. The Hall was burnt down in 1945. Dunston, our nearest neighbour, is only three quarters of a mile North of Metheringham. It has a population of 517 people, a small modern primary school and a church.
